abstract.p: Singapore's nonoil exports rose 11.7 percent in September compared with level for September 1999, below expectations (S)

block.p: Falling demand for computer disk drives and chemicals offset rising demand for semiconductors to crimp Singapore's export growth last month, the government said. Nonoil exports rose 11.7 percent in September compared with the level for September 1999, below expectations, with slower shipments to the United States and Europe. Although economic growth in Singapore has been quickening this year, the data heightened concerns in financial markets that slumping global demand for electronics could mean trouble for Singapore and Southeast Asia's other export-dependent economies.

Falling demand for computer disk drives and chemicals offset rising demand for semiconductors to crimp Singapore's export growth last month, the government said. Nonoil exports rose 11.7 percent in September compared with the level for September 1999, below expectations, with slower shipments to the United States and Europe. Although economic growth in Singapore has been quickening this year, the data heightened concerns in financial markets that slumping global demand for electronics could mean trouble for Singapore and Southeast Asia's other export-dependent economies.
